## **Additional Resources**

For detailed package information, installation instructions, and development roadmaps, see the individual package pages linked in the Documentation column above.

### **Key Links**

- [Architecture & Data Flows](developer-architecture.html) - Understanding how packages work together
- [Contributing Guidelines](developer-contributing.html) - How to contribute to packages
- [Deployment Strategies](developer-deployment.html) - Installing and deploying the toolchain
- [Project Management](project-management.html) - Roadmaps and development process

### **Quick Start**

The fastest way to get started with the Gaia toolchain is via gaiaDocker:

```bash
git clone https://github.com/OHDSI/gaiaDocker.git
cd gaiaDocker
docker compose --profile gaia up -d
```

See the [Deployment guide](developer-deployment.html) for more options.

<br>

## **Vocabulary & Schema Extensions**

**OMOP GIS Vocabulary Package** - [TuftsCTSI/CVB](https://github.com/TuftsCTSI/CVB)
- Extensions to OMOP Vocabulary for geospatial entities, environmental exposures, and social determinants of health
- Delta vocabulary files available in [CVB/GIS/Ontology](https://github.com/TuftsCTSI/CVB/tree/main/GIS/Ontology)
- See [vocabulary documentation](vocabulary.html) and [Vocabulary Roadmap](https://github.com/OHDSI/GIS/issues/369)

**OMOP GIS Schema Extensions**
- External_Exposure and Location_History tables for place-based health determinants
- See [Schema Extensions documentation](schema-extensions.html)

<br>
